get.description: Get all service-wide feed creation and administration permissions.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: includeIds
parameters.description: Set to true to add IdentityIds to the permission objects.

patch.description: Set service-wide permissions that govern feed creation and administration.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: New permissions for the organization.

get.description:
Query to determine which feeds have changed since the last call, tracked through the provided continuationToken. Only changes to a feed itself are returned and impact the continuationToken, not additions or alterations to packages within the feeds.

If the project parameter is present, gets all feed changes in the given project.
If omitted, gets all feed changes in the organization.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: includeDeleted
parameters.description: If true, get changes for all feeds including deleted feeds. The default value is false.

parameters.name: continuationToken
parameters.description: A continuation token which acts as a bookmark to a previously retrieved change. This token allows the user to continue retrieving changes in batches, picking up where the previous batch left off. If specified, all the changes that occur strictly after the token will be returned. If not specified or 0, iteration will start with the first change.

parameters.name: batchSize
parameters.description: Number of package changes to fetch. The default value is 1000. The maximum value is 2000.

get.description:
Query a feed to determine its current state.

The project parameter must be supplied if the feed was created in a project.
If the feed is not associated with any project, omit the project parameter from the request.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: feedId
parameters.description: Name or ID of the feed.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

get.description:
Query for feeds within the recycle bin.

If the project parameter is present, gets all feeds in recycle bin in the given project.
If omitted, gets all feeds in recycle bin in the organization.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

post.description:
Create a feed, a container for various package types.

Feeds can be created in a project if the project parameter is included in the request url.
If the project parameter is omitted, the feed will not be associated with a project and will be created at the organization level.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A JSON object containing both required and optional attributes for the feed. Name is the only required value.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

get.description:
Get all feeds in an account where you have the provided role access.

If the project parameter is present, gets all feeds in the given project.
If omitted, gets all feeds in the organization.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: feedRole
parameters.description: Filter by this role, either Administrator(4), Contributor(3), or Reader(2) level permissions.

values.description: Unsupported.
Unsupported.
Readers can only read packages and view settings.
Contributors can do anything to packages in the feed including adding new packages, but they may not modify feed settings.
Administrators have total control over the feed.
Collaborators have the same permissions as readers, but can also ingest packages from configured upstream sources.

parameters.name: includeDeletedUpstreams
parameters.description: Include upstreams that have been deleted in the response.

parameters.name: includeUrls
parameters.description: Resolve names if true

delete.description:
Remove a feed and all its packages. The feed moves to the recycle bin and is reversible.

The project parameter must be supplied if the feed was created in a project.
If the feed is not associated with any project, omit the project parameter from the request.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: feedId
parameters.description: Name or Id of the feed.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

get.description:
Get the settings for a specific feed.

The project parameter must be supplied if the feed was created in a project.
If the feed is not associated with any project, omit the project parameter from the request.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: feedId
parameters.description: Name or Id of the feed.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: includeDeletedUpstreams
parameters.description: Include upstreams that have been deleted in the response.

patch.description:
Change the attributes of a feed.

The project parameter must be supplied if the feed was created in a project.
If the feed is not associated with any project, omit the project parameter from the request.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A JSON object containing the feed settings to be updated.

parameters.name: feedId
parameters.description: Name or Id of the feed.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

get.description:
Get a batch of package changes made to a feed.  The changes returned are 'most recent change' so if an Add is followed by an Update before you begin enumerating, you'll only see one change in the batch.  While consuming batches using the continuation token, you may see changes to the same package version multiple times if they are happening as you enumerate.

The project parameter must be supplied if the feed was created in a project.
If the feed is not associated with any project, omit the project parameter from the request.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: feedId
parameters.description: Name or Id of the feed.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: continuationToken
parameters.description: A continuation token which acts as a bookmark to a previously retrieved change. This token allows the user to continue retrieving changes in batches, picking up where the previous batch left off. If specified, all the changes that occur strictly after the token will be returned. If not specified or 0, iteration will start with the first change.

parameters.name: batchSize
parameters.description: Number of package changes to fetch. The default value is 1000. The maximum value is 2000.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

get.description:
Get details about all of the packages in the feed. Use the various filters to include or exclude information from the result set.

The project parameter must be supplied if the feed was created in a project.
If the feed is not associated with any project, omit the project parameter from the request.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: feedId
parameters.description: Name or Id of the feed.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: protocolType
parameters.description: One of the supported artifact package types.

parameters.name: packageNameQuery
parameters.description: Filter to packages that contain the provided string. Characters in the string must conform to the package name constraints.

parameters.name: normalizedPackageName
parameters.description: [Obsolete] Used for legacy scenarios and may be removed in future versions.

parameters.name: includeUrls
parameters.description: True to return REST Urls with the response. Default is True.

parameters.name: includeAllVersions
parameters.description: True to return all versions of the package in the response. Default is false (latest version only).

parameters.name: isListed
parameters.description: Only applicable for NuGet packages, setting it for other package types will result in a 404. If false, delisted package versions will be returned. Use this to filter the response when includeAllVersions is set to true. Default is unset (do not return delisted packages).

parameters.name: getTopPackageVersions
parameters.description: Changes the behavior of $top and $skip to return all versions of each package up to $top. Must be used in conjunction with includeAllVersions=true

parameters.name: isRelease
parameters.description: Only applicable for Nuget packages. Use this to filter the response when includeAllVersions is set to true. Default is True (only return packages without prerelease versioning).

parameters.name: includeDescription
parameters.description: Return the description for every version of each package in the response. Default is False.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Get the top N packages (or package versions where getTopPackageVersions=true)

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Skip the first N packages (or package versions where getTopPackageVersions=true)

parameters.name: includeDeleted
parameters.description: Return deleted or unpublished versions of packages in the response. Default is False.

parameters.name: isCached
parameters.description: [Obsolete] Used for legacy scenarios and may be removed in future versions.

parameters.name: directUpstreamId
parameters.description: Filter results to return packages from a specific upstream.

get.description:
Get details about a specific package.

The project parameter must be supplied if the feed was created in a project.
If the feed is not associated with any project, omit the project parameter from the request.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: feedId
parameters.description: Name or Id of the feed.

parameters.name: packageId
parameters.description: The package Id (GUID Id, not the package name).

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: includeAllVersions
parameters.description: True to return all versions of the package in the response. Default is false (latest version only).

parameters.name: includeUrls
parameters.description: True to return REST Urls with the response. Default is True.

parameters.name: isListed
parameters.description: Only applicable for NuGet packages, setting it for other package types will result in a 404. If false, delisted package versions will be returned. Use this to filter the response when includeAllVersions is set to true. Default is unset (do not return delisted packages).

parameters.name: isRelease
parameters.description: Only applicable for Nuget packages. Use this to filter the response when includeAllVersions is set to true.  Default is True (only return packages without prerelease versioning).

parameters.name: includeDeleted
parameters.description: Return deleted or unpublished versions of packages in the response. Default is False.

parameters.name: includeDescription
parameters.description: Return the description for every version of each package in the response. Default is False.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

get.description:

parameters.name: feedId

parameters.name: packageId
parameters.description: Id of the package (GUID Id, not name).

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: includeUrls
parameters.description: True to include urls for each version. Default is true.

parameters.name: isListed
parameters.description: Only applicable for NuGet packages. If false, delisted package versions will be returned.

parameters.name: isDeleted
parameters.description: If set specifies whether to return only deleted or non-deleted versions of packages in the response. Default is unset (return all versions).

get.description:

parameters.name: packageVersionId
parameters.description: Id of the package version (GUID Id, not name).

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: includeUrls
parameters.description: True to include urls for each version. Default is true.

parameters.name: isListed
parameters.description: Only applicable for NuGet packages. If false, delisted package versions will be returned.

parameters.name: isDeleted
parameters.description: This does not have any effect on the requested package version, for other versions returned specifies whether to return only deleted or non-deleted versions of packages in the response. Default is unset (return all versions).

get.description:
Generate a SVG badge for the latest version of a package.  The generated SVG is typically used as the image in an HTML link which takes users to the feed containing the package to accelerate discovery and consumption.

The project parameter must be supplied if the feed was created in a project.
If the feed is not associated with any project, omit the project parameter from the request.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: feedId
parameters.description: Name or Id of the feed.

parameters.name: packageId
parameters.description: Id of the package (GUID Id, not name).

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

badgesEnabled.description: If set, this feed supports generation of package badges.

defaultViewId.description: The view that the feed administrator has indicated is the default experience for readers.

deletedDate.description: The date that this feed was deleted.

description.description: A description for the feed.  Descriptions must not exceed 255 characters.

hideDeletedPackageVersions.description: If set, the feed will hide all deleted/unpublished versions

permanentDeletedDate.description: The date that this feed was permanently deleted.

scheduledPermanentDeleteDate.description: The date that this feed is scheduled to be permanently deleted.

upstreamEnabledChangedDate.description: If set, time that the UpstreamEnabled property was changed. Will be null if UpstreamEnabled was never changed after Feed creation.

url.description: The URL of the base feed in GUID form.

FeedChange.description: A container that encapsulates the state of the feed after a create, update, or delete.

values.description: A package version was added or updated.
A package version was deleted.
A feed was permanently deleted. This is not used for package version.

feed.description: The state of the feed after a after a create, update, or delete operation completed.

feedContinuationToken.description: A token that identifies the next change in the log of changes.

latestPackageContinuationToken.description: A token that identifies the latest package change for this feed.  This can be used to quickly determine if there have been any changes to packages in a specific feed.

FeedChangesResponse.description: A result set containing the feed changes for the range that was requested.

count.description: The number of changes in this set.

feedChanges.description: A container that encapsulates the state of the feed after a create, update, or delete.

nextFeedContinuationToken.description: When iterating through the log of changes this value indicates the value that should be used for the next continuation token.

FeedCore.description: An object that contains all of the settings for a specific feed.

values.description: No flags exist for this feed
This feed can serve packages from upstream sources Upstream packages must be manually promoted to views
This feed is currently under maintenance and may have reduced functionality
The capabilities given to a newly created feed

fullyQualifiedId.description: This will either be the feed GUID or the feed GUID and view GUID depending on how the feed was accessed.

fullyQualifiedName.description: Full name of the view, in feed@view format.

id.description: A GUID that uniquely identifies this feed.

isReadOnly.description: If set, all packages in the feed are immutable.  It is important to note that feed views are immutable; therefore, this flag will always be set for views.

name.description: A name for the feed. feed names must follow these rules: <list type="bullet"><item><description> Must not exceed 64 characters </description></item><item><description> Must not contain whitespaces </description></item><item><description> Must not start with an underscore or a period </description></item><item><description> Must not end with a period </description></item><item><description> Must not contain any of the following illegal characters: <![CDATA[ @, ~, ;, {, }, \, +, =, <, >, |, /, \\, ?, :, &, $, *, \", #, [, ] ]]></description></item></list>

project.description: The project that this feed is associated with.

upstreamEnabled.description: This should always be true. Setting to false will override all sources in UpstreamSources.

upstreamSources.description: A list of sources that this feed will fetch packages from.  An empty list indicates that this feed will not search any additional sources for packages.

identityId.description: Id of the identity associated with this role.

isInheritedRole.description: Boolean indicating whether the role is inherited or set directly.

role.description: The role for this identity on a feed.

values.description: Unsupported.
Unsupported.
Readers can only read packages and view settings.
Contributors can do anything to packages in the feed including adding new packages, but they may not modify feed settings.
Administrators have total control over the feed.
Collaborators have the same permissions as readers, but can also ingest packages from configured upstream sources.

ageLimitInDays.description: This attribute is deprecated and is not honoured by retention

countLimit.description: Maximum versions to preserve per package and package type.

daysToKeepRecentlyDownloadedPackages.description: Number of days to preserve a package version after its latest download.

FeedUpdate.description: Update a feed definition with these new values.

allowUpstreamNameConflict.description: If set, the feed will allow upload of packages that exist on the upstream

badgesEnabled.description: If set, this feed supports generation of package badges.

defaultViewId.description: The view that the feed administrator has indicated is the default experience for readers.

description.description: A description for the feed.  Descriptions must not exceed 255 characters.

hideDeletedPackageVersions.description: If set, feed will hide all deleted/unpublished versions

id.description: A GUID that uniquely identifies this feed.

name.description: A name for the feed. feed names must follow these rules: <list type="bullet"><item><description> Must not exceed 64 characters </description></item><item><description> Must not contain whitespaces </description></item><item><description> Must not start with an underscore or a period </description></item><item><description> Must not end with a period </description></item><item><description> Must not contain any of the following illegal characters: <![CDATA[ @, ~, ;, {, }, \, +, =, <, >, |, /, \\, ?, :, &, $, *, \", #, [, ] ]]></description></item></list>

upstreamEnabled.description: If set, the feed can proxy packages from an upstream feed

upstreamSources.description: A list of sources that this feed will fetch packages from.  An empty list indicates that this feed will not search any additional sources for packages.

FeedView.description: A view on top of a feed.

values.description: Default, unspecified view type.
View used as a promotion destination to classify released artifacts.
Internal view type that is automatically created and managed by the system.
Only accessible by the permissions explicitly set by the feed administrator.
Feed is accessible by all the valid users present in the organization where the feed resides (for example across organization 'myorg' at 'dev.azure.com/myorg')
Feed is accessible by all the valid users present in the enterprise where the feed resides. Note that legacy naming and back compat leaves the name of this value out of sync with its new meaning.
Feed is accessible by all the valid users present in the Azure Active Directory tenant.

GlobalPermission.description: Permissions for feed service-wide operations such as the creation of new feeds.

identityDescriptor.description: Identity of the user with the provided Role.

values.description: Invalid default value.
Explicit no permissions.
Ability to create new feeds.
Read and manage any feed

IdentityDescriptor.description: An Identity descriptor is a wrapper for the identity type (Windows SID, Passport) along with a unique identifier such as the SID or PUID.

identifier.description: The unique identifier for this identity, not exceeding 256 chars, which will be persisted.

identityType.description: Type of descriptor (for example, Windows, Passport, etc.).

JsonPatchDocument.description: The JSON model for JSON Patch Operations

JsonPatchOperation.description: The JSON model for a JSON Patch operation

from.description: The path to copy from for the Move/Copy operation.

path.description: The path for the operation. In the case of an array, a zero based index can be used to specify the position in the array (e.g. /biscuits/0/name). The "-" character can be used instead of an index to insert at the end of the array (e.g. /biscuits/-).

value.description: The value for the operation. This is either a primitive or a JToken.

MinimalPackageVersion.description: Core data about any package, including its id and version information and basic state.

directUpstreamSourceId.description: Upstream source this package was ingested from.

isCachedVersion.description: [Obsolete] Used for legacy scenarios and may be removed in future versions.

isDeleted.description: True if this package has been deleted.

isLatest.description: True if this is the latest version of the package by package type sort order.

isListed.description: (NuGet and Cargo Only) True if this package is listed.

normalizedVersion.description: Normalized version using normalization rules specific to a package type.

publishDate.description: UTC Date the package was published to the service.

views.description: List of views containing this package version.

status.description: The current status of the operation.

values.description: The operation does not have a status set.
The operation has been queued.
The operation is in progress.
The operation was cancelled by the user.
The operation completed successfully.
The operation completed with a failure.

url.description: URL to get the full operation object.

Package.description: A package, which is a container for one or more package versions.

isCached.description: Used for legacy scenarios and may be removed in future versions.

name.description: The display name of the package.

normalizedName.description: The normalized name representing the identity of this package within its package type.

starCount.description: [Obsolete] - this field is unused and will be removed in a future release.

versions.description: All versions for this package within its feed.

PackageChange.description: A single change to a feed's packages.

packageVersionChange.description: Change that was performed on a package version.

PackageChangesResponse.description: A set of change operations to a feed's packages.

count.description: Number of changes in this batch.

nextPackageContinuationToken.description: Token that should be used in future calls for this feed to retrieve new changes.

PackageDependency.description: A dependency on another package version.

group.description: Dependency package group (an optional classification within some package types).

PackageFile.description: A package file for a specific package version, only relevant to package types that contain multiple files per version.

protocolMetadata.description: Extended data unique to a specific package type.

PackageMetrics.description: All metrics for a certain package id

downloadCount.description: Total count of downloads per package id.

downloadUniqueUsers.description: Number of downloads per unique user per package id.

lastDownloaded.description: UTC date and time when package was last downloaded.

PackageVersion.description: A specific version of a package.

deletedDate.description: UTC date that this package version was deleted.

dependencies.description: List of dependencies for this package version.

files.description: Files associated with this package version, only relevant for multi-file package types.

protocolMetadata.description: Extended data specific to a package type.

sourceChain.description: List of upstream sources through which a package version moved to land in this feed.

PackageVersionChange.description: A change to a single package version.

changeType.description: The type of change that was performed.

values.description: A package version was added or updated.
A package version was deleted.
A feed was permanently deleted. This is not used for package version.

continuationToken.description: Token marker for this change, allowing the caller to send this value back to the service and receive changes beyond this one.

PackageVersionMetrics.description: All metrics for a certain package version id

downloadCount.description: Total count of downloads per package version id.

downloadUniqueUsers.description: Number of downloads per unique user per package version id.

lastDownloaded.description: UTC date and time when package version was last downloaded.

PackageVersionMetricsQuery.description: Query to get package version metrics

PackageVersionProvenance.description: Provenance for a published package version

feedId.description: Name or Id of the feed.

packageId.description: Id of the package (GUID Id, not name).

packageVersionId.description: Id of the package version (GUID Id, not name).

provenance.description: Provenance information for this package version.

id.description: Gets or sets id of the project.

name.description: Gets or sets name of the project.

visibility.description: Gets or sets visibility of the project.

ProtocolMetadata.description: Extended metadata for a specific package type.

data.description: Extended metadata for a specific package type, formatted to the associated schema version definition.

Provenance.description: Data about the origin of a published package

provenanceSource.description: Type of provenance source, for example "InternalBuild", "InternalRelease"

publisherUserIdentity.description: Identity of user that published the package

userAgent.description: HTTP User-Agent used when pushing the package.

RecycleBinPackageVersion.description: A single package version within the recycle bin.

scheduledPermanentDeleteDate.description: UTC date on which the package will automatically be removed from the recycle bin and permanently deleted.

ReferenceLinks.description: The class to represent a collection of REST reference links.

links.description: The readonly view of the links.  Because Reference links are readonly, we only want to expose them as read only.

UpstreamSource.description: Upstream source definition, including its Identity, package type, and other associated information.

deletedDate.description: UTC date that this upstream was deleted.

displayLocation.description: Locator for connecting to the upstream source in a user friendly format, that may potentially change over time

internalUpstreamCollectionId.description: For an internal upstream type, track the Azure DevOps organization that contains it.

internalUpstreamFeedId.description: For an internal upstream type, track the feed id being referenced.

internalUpstreamProjectId.description: For an internal upstream type, track the project of the feed being referenced.

internalUpstreamViewId.description: For an internal upstream type, track the view of the feed being referenced.

location.description: Consistent locator for connecting to the upstream source.

protocol.description: Package type associated with the upstream source.

serviceEndpointId.description: The identity of the service endpoint that holds credentials to use when accessing the upstream.

serviceEndpointProjectId.description: Specifies the projectId of the Service Endpoint.

status.description: Specifies the status of the upstream.

values.description: Upstream source is ok.
Upstream source is disabled.

statusDetails.description: Provides a human-readable reason for the status of the upstream.

upstreamSourceType.description: Source type, such as Public or Internal.

values.description: Publicly available source.
Azure DevOps upstream source.

reason.description: Provides a human-readable reason for the status of the upstream.

VssJsonCollectionWrapper.description: This class is used to serialize collections as a single JSON object on the wire.

api-Version.name: api-version
api-Version.description: Version of the API to use.  This should be set to '7.1' to use this version of the api.

api-Version-preview.1.name: api-version
api-Version-preview.1.description: Version of the API to use.  This should be set to '7.1-preview.1' to use this version of the api.

accessToken.description: Personal access token. Use any value for the user name and the token as the password.

scopes.vso.packaging_write: Grants the ability to create and read feeds and packages.
scopes.vso.packaging: Grants the ability to read feeds and packages. Also grants the ability to search packages.
scopes.vso.packaging_manage: Grants the ability to create, read, update, and delete feeds and packages.
